aboutSummit.title: <primary>A unique event</primary> bringing together leading experts, entrepreneurs, scientists, and innovators from <secondary>around the world.</secondary>
aboutSummit.text1: This is not just an exhibition, but a platform for exchanging ideas, promoting new technologies, and building global partnerships. RES 2026 is a chance to be part of a transformation shaping the future of our planet.
aboutSummit.text2: We live in an era where innovation and sustainable development are top priorities. At the summit, you will see how cutting-edge ideas and solutions can change the world for the better. We invite you to join this movement and build an inspiring future together.

programms.title: Program
programms.text: Each day of RES 2026 will bring inspiration, discoveries, and opportunities for collaboration. Follow key moments, including evening events, networking sessions, and awards for outstanding innovative projects.

speakers.text: RES 2026 will gather the brightest minds of our time.
speakers.text1: We are proud to present global leaders in technology, sustainability, and science. Our speakers are those shaping the future through impactful decisions.

partners.text: RES 2026 would not be possible without the support of our respected organizers, partners, and media partners.
partners.text1: These leading companies and organizations play a key role in delivering this unique event and showcasing world-class ideas and technologies.

connectionBanner.text: Join us at RES 2026 — a unique event becoming the center of innovation, technology, and sustainable development!

footer.text: The exhibition will take place at the EXPO International Exhibition Center, one of the country’s main venues for global events and innovative projects.

about.title: About the Summit
about.presidentText:
"Kazakhstan, in partnership with the UN and other international organizations, will host the Regional Ecological Summit in Astana in April of next year. 

 As part of our broader commitments in environmental protection, Kazakhstan is implementing the nationwide campaign 'Taza Kazakhstan'. 

 This nationwide movement unites millions of volunteers who participate in cleanup actions, waste reduction, and environmental education".
about.presidentInitiativeText:
"However, development cannot be sustainable without addressing the climate crisis. Central Asia is one of the regions most vulnerable to climate change on the planet. Warming here occurs twice as fast as the global average. In response, we are advancing a pragmatic and regionally coordinated climate agenda. Our commitments include participation in various international organizations and agreements. 

 In 2026, Kazakhstan, in partnership with the UN, will host the Regional Ecological Summit, which is intended to become a platform for uniting Central Asian strategies and global ambitions". 

 WHERE THE IDEA WAS VOICED (78th UN General Assembly, September 2023)
about.presidentPosition: From the speech of the President of Kazakhstan Kassym-Jomart Tokayev at the general debate of the 80th session of the UN General Assembly
about.text2: The Regional Ecological Summit 2026, initiated by the President of Kazakhstan Kassym-Jomart Tokayev, aims to unite Central Asian countries in partnership with the UN to develop coordinated solutions to climate and environmental challenges. This is a two-year process (2024–2026) that has received broad international and political support. The Summit's concept incorporates the idea of 'Bir Tamyr' ('One Root') - a symbol of common heritage and collective action for the sustainable future of the region.
about.text3: The Regional Ecological Summit 2026 in partnership with the UN will unite Central Asian countries for coordinated solutions on climate and ecology, including preservation of the Aral Sea and reduction of the Caspian water basin, promotion of 'green' financing, low-carbon technologies, and strengthening regional resilience, as well as formation of joint initiatives, declarations, and an action program for 2026–2030 for sustainable development of the region.
about.aboutText1: The Regional Ecological Summit 2026 was initiated by the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan Kassym-Jomart Tokayev and aims to unite Central Asian countries to develop common solutions to combat climate change in partnership with the UN. This is not just a meeting - it is a two-year preparation process that started in 2024 and concludes with a high-level Summit in 2026, where coordinated environmental initiatives and mechanisms of regional cooperation will be presented.
about.aboutText2: The Summit has received broad support from international partners, including the UN, the secretariats of the three Rio Conventions (UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), UN Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) and UN Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD)), UNECE, UNDP, UN-Habitat, UNEP, UNICEF, UNFPA, FAO, UNESCO, UNIDO, WMO, ILO, OECD, IEA, IRENA, ADB, WB, IMWI, SWITCH-Asia and other organizations. In particular, the United Nations expressed its support in General Assembly Resolution 78/147 of December 19, 2023 'Central Asia Facing Environmental Challenges: Strengthening Regional Solidarity for Sustainable Development and Prosperity'.
about.aboutText3: Support for the initiative has also been enshrined in a number of key political documents at the level of heads of state:
about.aboutText31: Karabakh Declaration of the Informal Summit of the Organization of Turkic States (July 6, 2024, Azerbaijan);
about.aboutText32: Joint Statement of the Sixth Consultative Meeting of Heads of State of Central Asia (August 9, 2024, Kazakhstan);
about.aboutText33: Bishkek Declaration of the Eleventh Summit of the Organization of Turkic States (November 6, 2024, Kyrgyz Republic).
about.aboutText34: In 2025, this initiative received further recognition during the International Forum in Astana, the opening ceremony of the UN Regional Center for Sustainable Development Goals for Central Asia and Afghanistan with the participation of UN Secretary-General António Guterres and the Third UN Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries (Turkmenistan). At the heart of the initiative is the idea of 'Bir Tamyr' (One Root). The word 'tamyr' exists in almost all languages of the region and carries a deep image: roots of nature, veins of the earth, vessels of culture. This is a metaphor for connection, sustainability and common heritage that unites Central Asia not by political boundaries, but by meaning, memory and future. The Summit reflects this image: one region - common challenges - collective action. It will unite states, international organizations, the scientific community, business, civil society and youth to lay the foundation for a common environmentally sustainable future.
about.aboutText4:
"However, development cannot be sustainable without addressing the climate crisis. Central Asia is one of the regions most vulnerable to climate change on the planet. Warming here occurs twice as fast as the global average. In response, we are advancing a pragmatic and regionally coordinated climate agenda. Our commitments include participation in various international organizations and agreements. 

 In 2026, Kazakhstan, in partnership with the UN, will host the Regional Ecological Summit, which is intended to become a platform for uniting Central Asian strategies and global ambitions".
about.aboutText5:
The Regional Ecological Summit 2026 in partnership with the UN is a platform for uniting Central Asian countries in developing coordinated working solutions and mechanisms that reflect a regional approach to addressing climate and environmental challenges, including the tragedy of the Aral Sea, which has become a global symbol of natural degradation, and the sustainable decline of the Caspian Sea level. Special attention will be paid to shaping the real needs of Central Asia in 'green' financing aimed at supporting adaptation measures, developing low-carbon technologies and strengthening the region's environmental resilience. 

 The Summit creates a regional platform for dialogue and solidarity, strengthening cooperation between states, international organizations, scientific and business communities. It contributes to raising awareness of priority environmental issues, finding practical solutions and forming joint action plans for the future aimed at sustainable development of the region. The goal is to form specific initiatives and mechanisms for joint action. Adoption of a Joint Declaration of the Heads of State of Central Asia on Regional Cooperation in Ecology and Sustainable Development. 

 Approval of the Regional Action Program with UN agencies (2026–2030) for a sustainable future of Central Asia, including regional initiatives on the thematic areas of the Summit, launch of new environmental projects and initiatives in the Summit's areas. Summit preparation began in 2024 and includes a series of regional consultations. The Summit will be the culmination of this process and give political impetus to the region's environmental agenda. The initiative strengthens the existing efforts of countries, complementing them with a regional dimension. The basis will be a coordinated environmental agenda, including updated climate goals of Central Asian countries.
